description: 30 minutes of walking per day or 30 minutes of brisk cycling several times a week can cut heart disease risk by up to 50%, and reduces the risk of some cancers, depression, obesity, diabetes, and osteoporosis.

steps.content: A pair of comfortable shoes are essential for a nice walk. Depending on the weather you may also want to bring your sunglasses and some water with you.
steps.title: Get Ready

steps.content: You don’t have to walk far. Even a short stroll to your neighborhood store can save you gas and help you get fit.
steps.title: Think about where you’d like to go

steps.content: Just go out and walk around to explore your neighborhood.
steps.title: Go walking

tips.content: A study showed that short bouts of brisk walking (three 10-minute walks per day) resulted in similar improvements in fitness and were at least as effective in decreasing body fatness as long bouts (one 30 minute walk per day)

steps.content: Go to a local bicycle store to get some expert help on finding the right bike that fits your lifestyle, preference, size, and budget.
steps.title: Find a bike

steps.content: Where do you want to go? A scenic spot? A nice cafe? Find a nice route that takes your there safely.
steps.title: Plan a route

steps.content: Wear a helmet. Use bike lights. Check and signal before turning. Just following a few simple rules will enhance your whole riding experience.
steps.title: Ride safely

tips: Wearing a helmet makes cycling 85% safer in New York City. (New York, NY)
Bicycles save you money, keep you in shape, and help you experience your city in new ways. (Everywhere)
Cycling is usually the fastest way to travel for trips of up to 6 miles in the city. (Everywhere)
tasks.title: Ride a bike

steps.content: Find a company that offers car or bicycle sharing system close to you.
steps.title: Locate rental

steps.content: Reserve a car or bike if/when needed
steps.title: Reserve

tips: Smart cards allow the bicycles to be returned to any station in the system, which makes it easy to ride one-way to work and school.
tasks.title: Rent instead of Own
